p: Circadian clock mechanisms have been investigated in single neurons (Michel et al. 1993), unicellular algae (Roenneberg and Deng 1997), microorganisms (Merrow et al. 1999), and higher plants (Greenham and McClung 2015; Greenham et al. 2017). All components of this endogenous clock occur at the cellular level. This complex temporal program is a prerequisite for specialization, fitness, and survival within the chrono-ecological niches of the “temporal–space” day and enables organisms to thrive by integrating environmental changes with endogenous circadian systems (Roenneberg et al. 1995).
